alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 12 at 7:39PM EDT until September 14 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 10 PM EDT THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone on Wednesday and 7 to 10 feet on Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...The ocean beaches of Suffolk and Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Wednesday to 10 PM EDT Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM EDT Wednesday through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Based on the National Hurricane Center forecast track and intensity of Hurricane Lee, these hazards will likely persist into at least Saturday
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk
